name: 2C-B
appearance: White powder, sometimes in tablet or capsule form

details.description: A synthetic drug that belongs to the 2C family of psychedelics. It is known for combining psychedelic, euphoric, and empathogenic effects.
details.effects: Altered perception of time, enhanced tactile sensations, visual distortions, euphoria.
details.dosage: Oral dosage: Light: 5-15 mg, Common: 15-25 mg, Strong: 25-50 mg
details.usage: Often ingested orally. It can also be insufflated, but this is less common due to the associated pain and increased risk.
details.duration: 4-6 hours
details.risks: Potential for psychological dependence, increased heart rate, nausea.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, headache, muscle tension, and insomnia.
details.sexUse: Some users report enhanced tactile sensations, but individual responses may vary.
details.mixedUse: It is strongly advised not to mix with alcohol or other substances to reduce the risk of adverse effects.
details.otherInformation: It is illegal in many countries and its possession, manufacture, or distribution may be punished by law.

name: 3-CMC
appearance: White or off-white crystalline powder

details.description: A research chemical with stimulant properties, belonging to the cathinone class.
details.effects: Stimulation, euphoria, increased focus, and motivation.
details.dosage: Not well documented due to its status as a research chemical. Use is not advised.
details.usage: Can be ingested orally or insufflated, but again, use is not advised due to the lack of safety data.
details.duration: Varies, but typically several hours.
details.risks: Potential for addiction, neurotoxicity, and other adverse effects. Lack of safety data makes its use particularly risky.
details.sideEffects: Potential side effects include increased heart rate, hypertension, and anxiety.
details.sexUse: Not documented.
details.mixedUse: Due to the lack of safety data, mixing with other substances could potentially be very dangerous.
details.otherInformation: As a research chemical, it is not intended for human consumption, and its sale may be restricted in many jurisdictions.

name: 3-MMC
appearance: White crystalline powder

details.description: A synthetic stimulant from the substituted cathinone family, which is structurally similar to mephedrone.
details.effects: Euphoria, increased energy and focus, empathy.
details.dosage: Not well-documented; use is generally not advised due to lack of safety data.
details.usage: Can be ingested orally or insufflated; usage is not recommended due to lack of safety data.
details.duration: 4-6 hours.
details.risks: Potential for addiction, unknown long-term effects due to lack of research.
details.sideEffects: Increased heart rate, hypertension, anxiety, paranoia.
details.sexUse: Not documented.
details.mixedUse: Use with other substances is not advised due to potential for unknown adverse effects.
details.otherInformation: Considered a research chemical and not intended for human consumption. Legal status varies by country.

name: 4-FA
appearance: White or slightly yellowish powder, often found in tablet or capsule form

details.description: A synthetic stimulant drug that has both stimulant and entactogenic effects.
details.effects: Euphoria, increased energy, empathy, increased sociability.
details.dosage: Dosages vary, typically ranging from 50-200mg, but it is not medically sanctioned for human consumption and using it can be extremely dangerous.
details.usage: Orally in capsule or tablet form, sometimes snorted.
details.duration: 4-8 hours, depending on the dosage and individual metabolism.
details.risks: Neurotoxicity, cardiovascular issues, addiction, and potential legal consequences.
details.sideEffects: Insomnia, anxiety, headaches, and potential severe health issues.
details.sexUse: Not documented.
details.mixedUse: Combining it with other substances can significantly increase the risk of adverse effects.
details.otherInformation: Currently a substance of concern due to its potential for misuse and unknown long-term effects.

name: 4-MMC
appearance: White or slightly yellowish crystalline powder, often found in capsule or tablet form

details.description: A synthetic stimulant drug, part of the substituted cathinone class, similar in structure to amphetamines.
details.effects: Euphoria, increased energy, increased sociability, and empathy.
details.dosage: Doses range from 50-200mg, although it is not medically sanctioned for human consumption and can be extremely dangerous.
details.usage: Orally, snorted or injected.
details.duration: 2-4 hours depending on the method of administration.
details.risks: Addiction, potential neurotoxicity, cardiovascular issues, and potential legal consequences.
details.sideEffects: Anxiety, paranoia, hallucinations, and potential severe health issues.
details.sexUse: Not documented.
details.mixedUse: Combining it with other substances can significantly increase the risk of adverse effects.
details.otherInformation: Classified as a controlled substance in many countries due to its high potential for misuse.

name: 5-MeO-DALT
appearance: White or off-white crystalline powder

details.description: A synthetic psychedelic drug from the tryptamine family, similar to DMT.
details.effects: Visual and auditory hallucinations, altered perception of time and space.
details.dosage: Not well-documented; use is generally not advised due to lack of safety data.
details.usage: Can be ingested orally or insufflated; usage is not recommended due to lack of safety data.
details.duration: 4-6 hours.
details.risks: Potential for dangerous interactions with other drugs or medications, potential legal issues.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, vomiting, increased heart rate, increased blood pressure.
details.sexUse: Not typically associated with sexual use; can significantly alter perception and judgment.
details.mixedUse: Using with other substances can increase the risk of adverse effects.
details.otherInformation: Controlled substance in many jurisdictions; traditionally used in some indigenous religious ceremonies.

name: 5-MeO-MiPT
appearance: White or off-white crystalline powder

details.description: A synthetic psychedelic drug from the tryptamine family, similar to DMT.
details.effects: Visual and auditory hallucinations, altered perception of time and space.
details.dosage: Not well-documented; use is generally not advised due to lack of safety data.
details.usage: Can be ingested orally or insufflated; usage is not recommended due to lack of safety data.
details.duration: 4-6 hours.
details.risks: Potential for dangerous interactions with other drugs or medications, potential legal issues.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, vomiting, increased heart rate, increased blood pressure.
details.sexUse: Not typically associated with sexual use; can significantly alter perception and judgment.
details.mixedUse: Using with other substances can increase the risk of adverse effects.
details.otherInformation: Controlled substance in many jurisdictions; traditionally used in some indigenous religious ceremonies.

name: 6-APB
appearance: White or off-white crystalline powder

details.description: A synthetic drug with stimulant and entactogenic effects, similar to MDMA.
details.effects: Euphoria, increased energy, empathy, increased sociability.
details.dosage: Not well-documented; use is generally not advised due to lack of safety data.
details.usage: Can be ingested orally or insufflated; usage is not recommended due to lack of safety data.
details.duration: 4-6 hours.
details.risks: Potential for dangerous interactions with other drugs or medications, potential legal issues.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, vomiting, increased heart rate, increased blood pressure.
details.sexUse: Not typically associated with sexual use; can significantly alter perception and judgment.
details.mixedUse: Using with other substances can increase the risk of adverse effects.
details.otherInformation: Controlled substance in many jurisdictions; traditionally used in some indigenous religious ceremonies.

name: Acetaminophen
appearance: White crystalline powder, often found in tablet or capsule form

details.description: A pain reliever and fever reducer, commonly found in over-the-counter medications.
details.effects: Pain relief, fever reduction.
details.dosage: Dosages vary depending on the specific formulation and indication.
details.usage: Orally, as a tablet or capsule.
details.duration: 4-6 hours.
details.risks: Liver damage, potential legal issues.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, vomiting, constipation, and others.
details.sexUse: Not typically associated with sexual use.
details.mixedUse: Combining with other substances can increase the risk of adverse effects.
details.otherInformation: Widely available over-the-counter.

name: Alcohol
appearance: Liquid, can be clear or colored depending on the type (e.g., beer, wine, spirits).

details.description: A psychoactive substance that is found in beverages such as beer, wine, and spirits.
details.effects: Lowered inhibitions, relaxation, euphoria at moderate doses, depression of the central nervous system.
details.dosage: Varies widely based on the type of beverage and individual tolerance. Standard drink contains about 14 grams of pure alcohol.
details.usage: Orally.
details.duration: Effects can last several hours, depending on the amount consumed and individual factors.
details.risks: Addiction, liver damage, heart problems, potential legal consequences (e.g., DUI).
details.sideEffects: Hangover, which may include headache, nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea. Potential for alcohol poisoning with high doses.
details.sexUse: Can sometimes increase desire but decrease performance.
details.mixedUse: Can be extremely dangerous when mixed with other drugs, especially depressants.
details.otherInformation: Widely legal but regulated; minimum age requirements exist in many jurisdictions.

name: Alprazolam (Xanax®)
appearance: Small white tablets, sometimes with scores or imprints.

details.description: A benzodiazepine used to treat anxiety and panic disorders.
details.effects: Sedation, relaxation, and reduction of anxiety.
details.dosage: Prescribed dosages vary; misuse can lead to serious health complications.
details.usage: Orally, as a tablet.
details.duration: Effects last approximately 5-11 hours, depending on the specific formulation.
details.risks: Addiction, respiratory depression, impaired coordination, potential legal issues.
details.sideEffects: Drowsiness, dizziness, increased saliva production, change in sex drive, and others.
details.sexUse: Can cause decreased libido and sexual dysfunction.
details.mixedUse: Increased risk of adverse effects when combined with other substances, particularly other depressants or alcohol.
details.otherInformation: Schedule IV controlled substance in the US.

name: Amphetamine - Speed
appearance: White or off-white powder, sometimes found in tablet or capsule form

details.description: A powerful central nervous system stimulant that is used recreationally for its euphoric and energizing effects.
details.effects: Increased energy, euphoria, increased focus and alertness.
details.dosage: Varies depending on the purity and individual physiology, among other factors.
details.usage: Can be ingested orally, snorted, or injected.
details.duration: Effects can last several hours, depending on the method of administration.
details.risks: Addiction, heart problems, psychological issues such as anxiety and paranoia.
details.sideEffects: Insomnia, dry mouth, increased heart rate and blood pressure.
details.sexUse: Can increase libido, but chronic use can lead to sexual dysfunction.
details.mixedUse: Mixing with other substances can greatly increase the risks of adverse effects.
details.otherInformation: Recreational use is illegal in many jurisdictions, and misuse can lead to serious health problems.

name: Anabolic Androgen Steroids (AAS)
appearance: Pills, capsules, or injectable liquids.

details.description: Synthetic drugs that mimic the effects of testosterone in the body.
details.effects: Increased muscle mass and strength, potential for increased aggressiveness.
details.dosage: Varies widely, and usage outside of medical supervision is not recommended.
details.usage: Orally or through injection.
details.duration: Varies based on the specific substance and method of administration.
details.risks: Potential for severe health issues, including heart disease, liver damage, and increased risk of certain cancers.
details.sideEffects: Potential for severe side effects, including hormonal imbalances, mood swings, and physical changes.
details.sexUse: Can cause sexual dysfunction and other sex-related side effects.
details.mixedUse: Using with other substances can increase the risk of adverse effects.
details.otherInformation: Controlled substances in many jurisdictions due to their high potential for misuse and harm.

name: Buprenorphine (Subutex®)
appearance: White tablets or sublingual films.

details.description: A partial opioid agonist used in the treatment of opioid addiction.
details.effects: Pain relief, sedation, euphoria when misused.
details.dosage: Varies depending on the medical prescription, misuse can lead to serious health complications.
details.usage: Sublingually or, in misuse cases, through other routes such as injection.
details.duration: Effects can last approximately 24-60 hours.
details.risks: Addiction, respiratory depression, potential legal issues if misused.
details.sideEffects: Constipation, nausea, muscle aches, and potential dependency.
details.sexUse: May cause decreased libido.
details.mixedUse: Increased risk of adverse effects when combined with other substances, especially central nervous system depressants.
details.otherInformation: It is a controlled substance and should only be used under medical supervision.

name: Caffeine
appearance: White crystalline powder, also found in various beverages like coffee, tea, and energy drinks.

details.description: A central nervous system stimulant that is the most widely consumed psychoactive substance in the world.
details.effects: Increased alertness, reduced fatigue, improved concentration.
details.dosage: Typically up to 400 milligrams per day for most adults, which is roughly the amount in four cups of brewed coffee.
details.usage: Orally, through beverages, pills, or food products containing caffeine.
details.duration: Effects can last up to 6 hours, depending on individual sensitivity.
details.risks: Overconsumption can lead to restlessness, insomnia, headaches, dizziness, fast heartbeat, or other symptoms.
details.sideEffects: Might cause digestive issues, addiction, and may disrupt sleep patterns.
details.sexUse: No significant effects on sexual performance.
details.mixedUse: Combining with other stimulants can increase the risk of adverse effects.
details.otherInformation: Caffeine is a natural stimulant belonging to a class of drugs called xanthines.

name: Cocaine
appearance: White powder or crystalline rocks in its crack form.

details.description: A powerful stimulant made from the leaves of the coca plant native to South America.
details.effects: Increased energy, euphoria, increased heart rate, and elevated mood.
details.dosage: Recreational use is illegal and extremely dangerous, therefore a safe dosage is not applicable.
details.usage: Snorting, smoking (as crack cocaine), or injecting.
details.duration: Effects last between 15 to 30 minutes when snorted and even shorter durations when smoked or injected.
details.risks: High risk of addiction, overdose, cardiac arrest, respiratory failure, and other serious health issues.
details.sideEffects: Anxiety, paranoia, restlessness, and irritability.
details.sexUse: Can increase libido initially but may lead to sexual dysfunction with prolonged use.
details.mixedUse: Extremely dangerous to combine with other substances, especially depressants like alcohol.
details.otherInformation: Its use is associated with significant legal and health risks, including addiction and severe health problems.

name: Cannabis
appearance: Greenish-brown dried leaves and flowers of the Cannabis sativa plant.

details.description: A psychoactive substance derived from the Cannabis sativa plant, known for both recreational and medicinal uses.
details.effects: Relaxation, euphoria, increased appetite, altered perception of time.
details.dosage: Varies widely based on the route of administration and individual tolerance.
details.usage: Smoked, vaporized, or ingested orally (as in edibles).
details.duration: Effects last approximately 2-6 hours, depending on the route of administration.
details.risks: Impaired coordination, risk of addiction, potential legal issues depending on jurisdiction.
details.sideEffects: Dry mouth, red eyes, potential for increased anxiety or paranoia.
details.sexUse: Can affect sexual function in various ways, sometimes enhancing pleasure but potentially causing dysfunction.
details.mixedUse: Combining with other substances can increase the risk of adverse effects.
details.otherInformation: Legal status varies by region, with some areas allowing medicinal or recreational use.

name: Cathinone
appearance: Greenish-brown dried leaves and flowers of the Cannabis sativa plant.

details.description: A psychoactive substance derived from the Cannabis sativa plant, known for both recreational and medicinal uses.
details.effects: Relaxation, euphoria, increased appetite, altered perception of time.
details.dosage: Varies widely based on the route of administration and individual tolerance.
details.usage: Smoked, vaporized, or ingested orally (as in edibles).
details.duration: Effects last approximately 2-6 hours, depending on the route of administration.
details.risks: Impaired coordination, risk of addiction, potential legal issues depending on jurisdiction.
details.sideEffects: Dry mouth, red eyes, potential for increased anxiety or paranoia.
details.sexUse: Can affect sexual function in various ways, sometimes enhancing pleasure but potentially causing dysfunction.
details.mixedUse: Combining with other substances can increase the risk of adverse effects.
details.otherInformation: Legal status varies by region, with some areas allowing medicinal or recreational use.

name: Codeine
appearance: White crystalline powder, also available in various pharmaceutical preparations such as tablets and syrups.

details.description: An opiate used to treat mild to moderate pain and to relieve cough.
details.effects: Pain relief, euphoria, relaxation.
details.dosage: Typically prescribed in doses ranging from 15mg to 60mg.
details.usage: Orally, as prescribed by a healthcare provider. Recreational misuse involves higher doses or mixing with other substances.
details.duration: Effects can last approximately 4-6 hours.
details.risks: Addiction, respiratory depression, constipation.
details.sideEffects: Drowsiness, dizziness, nausea, vomiting.
details.sexUse: Can cause decreased libido and sexual dysfunction.
details.mixedUse: Increased risk of adverse effects, especially when mixed with alcohol or other CNS depressants.
details.otherInformation: A controlled substance with a high potential for addiction and misuse.

name: DMT and 5-MeO-DMT
appearance: White crystalline powder, sometimes found in plant materials. Ayahuasca is a brew made with plants containing DMT.

details.description: A powerful psychedelic drug found in certain plants and animals.
details.effects: Intense hallucinations, altered perception of time and space, spiritual experiences.
details.dosage: Varies, usually smoked in doses ranging from 5-60 mg (DMT).
details.usage: Smoked, vaporized, or used orally (as in the case of Ayahuasca).
details.duration: Rapid onset with a duration of 5-30 minutes when smoked. Ayahuasca can last several hours.
details.risks: Potential for psychological distress, bad trips, and dangerous behavior due to impaired judgment.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, vomiting (especially with Ayahuasca), increased heart rate.
details.sexUse: Not typically associated with sexual use.
details.mixedUse: Combining with other substances can significantly increase risks.
details.otherInformation: Use often involves complex preparation and is sometimes used in religious or spiritual contexts.

name: DOM - DOI - DOB
appearance: Usually available in tablet or blotter form.

details.description: Psychedelic amphetamines that induce hallucinogenic effects.
details.effects: Altered perception, hallucinations, increased energy and euphoria.
details.dosage: Varies, but generally in the range of 2-7mg for DOM. Similar ranges apply for DOI and DOB.
details.usage: Orally, usually ingested in tablet form or as a blotter paper.
details.duration: Long-lasting effects, generally lasting 12-20 hours.
details.risks: Increased heart rate, hypertension, potential for psychological distress, and bad trips.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, vomiting, anxiety, agitation.
details.sexUse: Not typically associated with sexual use.
details.mixedUse: Increased risk of adverse reactions and unpredictable effects when mixed with other substances.
details.otherInformation: Part of a class of drugs known as psychedelic amphetamines.

name: Dexamphetamine and Adderall
appearance: Tablets or capsules, often prescribed in pharmaceutical formulations.

details.description: Stimulant medications used primarily to treat ADHD and narcolepsy.
details.effects: Increased focus, energy, and alertness.
details.dosage: Prescribed dosage can vary, generally starting from 5mg.
details.usage: Orally, as prescribed by a healthcare provider.
details.duration: Effects can last 4-6 hours, extended-release formulas can last up to 12 hours.
details.risks: Potential for addiction, increased heart rate, hypertension.
details.sideEffects: Insomnia, dry mouth, decreased appetite, anxiety.
details.sexUse: Can cause changes in libido or sexual performance.
details.mixedUse: Increased risk of adverse effects, especially when mixed with alcohol or other stimulants.
details.otherInformation: A controlled substance with potential for misuse and addiction.

name: Dextromethorphan or Bexin®
appearance: Syrup, tablet, or gel capsule form.

details.description: An active ingredient in many over-the-counter cough suppressants.
details.effects: At higher doses, it can cause euphoria, hallucinations, and dissociation.
details.dosage: Medically, it is used in doses of 15-30mg. Recreational usage involves much higher doses, which can be dangerous.
details.usage: Orally, often ingested as syrup or in tablet form.
details.duration: Effects can last between 6-8 hours depending on the dosage.
details.risks: Potential for overdose, especially when mixed with other substances. Can cause liver damage in high doses.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, dizziness, vomiting, increased heart rate.
details.sexUse: Not typically associated with sexual use.
details.mixedUse: Dangerous when mixed with other substances due to increased risk of overdose and adverse effects.
details.otherInformation: Use outside of medical advice is strongly discouraged due to high risk of adverse effects.

name: Diacetylmorphine (Diaphin®)
appearance: White or brown powder, or as a black, sticky substance known as 'black tar heroin'.

details.description: A potent opioid derived from morphine, commonly known as heroin.
details.effects: Intense euphoria, pain relief, sedation.
details.dosage: Dosage varies widely, with a high risk of overdose due to the potency of the drug.
details.usage: Can be injected, snorted, or smoked.
details.duration: Effects can last several hours, but this varies depending on the route of administration.
details.risks: High risk of addiction and overdose, which can be fatal. Potential for severe respiratory depression.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, constipation, confusion, drowsiness.
details.sexUse: Can decrease libido and impair sexual performance.
details.mixedUse: Very high risk of adverse effects, including fatal overdose, especially when mixed with other depressants.
details.otherInformation: Strongly associated with addiction, crime, and other negative social outcomes.

name: Diazepam (Valium®)
appearance: Usually found as a pill, sometimes in liquid form.

details.description: A medication of the benzodiazepine family that typically produces a calming effect.
details.effects: Relief of anxiety, muscle spasms, and seizures. Can induce sleepiness.
details.dosage: Medically prescribed doses vary; recreational use is not advised due to high potential for addiction and overdose.
details.usage: Orally, sometimes injected.
details.duration: Effects can last for several hours, with peak effects occurring within 1-1.5 hours of ingestion.
details.risks: Addiction, respiratory depression, increased risk of accidents (due to impaired coordination).
details.sideEffects: Drowsiness, dizziness, tiredness, blurred vision, and in some cases, paradoxical increased anxiety or agitation.
details.sexUse: Can impair sexual performance and decrease libido.
details.mixedUse: High risk when mixed with other depressants; can lead to severe respiratory depression and death.
details.otherInformation: Withdrawal can be dangerous and should be medically supervised.

name: Ephedrine
appearance: White crystalline powder or tablet.

details.description: A medication and stimulant used to prevent low blood pressure during spinal anesthesia. It is also commonly used as a weight loss supplement.
details.effects: Increased heart rate, elevated blood pressure, and bronchial relaxation.
details.dosage: Medical dosage varies; it is not recommended for recreational use.
details.usage: Orally or by injection.
details.duration: Effects can last between 3-6 hours.
details.risks: Cardiovascular issues, potential for addiction, and neurotoxicity.
details.sideEffects: Nervousness, insomnia, vertigo, headache, tachycardia, and palpitations.
details.sexUse: Not typically associated with sexual use.
details.mixedUse: Increased risk of adverse effects when mixed with other stimulants or depressants.
details.otherInformation: It has been implicated in several instances of stroke, cardiac arrest, and death when used recreationally or as a weight loss supplement.

name: Etizolam
appearance: White powder or in tablet form.

details.description: A benzodiazepine analog with sedative, anxiolytic, and muscle relaxant properties, often used to treat anxiety and insomnia.
details.effects: Relaxation, drowsiness, reduced anxiety.
details.dosage: Typical medical dosage ranges from 0.25 to 2mg. Recreational use is not recommended.
details.usage: Orally, sublingually.
details.duration: Effects last for about 6 to 8 hours.
details.risks: Dependence, withdrawal syndrome, respiratory depression.
details.sideEffects: Drowsiness, muscle weakness, fainting.
details.sexUse: Can cause decreased libido and erectile dysfunction.
details.mixedUse: Can be very dangerous when mixed with other depressants like alcohol.
details.otherInformation: It is considered to be relatively safe when used medically, but recreational use increases the risk of adverse effects.

name: Fentanyl
appearance: White powder, also found in patch and injectable forms.

details.description: A synthetic opioid that is 80-100 times stronger than morphine. Used medically for pain management.
details.effects: Intense euphoria, pain relief.
details.dosage: Dosages vary significantly, but recreational use is extremely dangerous given the drug's potency.
details.usage: Injection, transdermal patch, or orally.
details.duration: Effects last about 1 to 2 hours.
details.risks: High risk of overdose and death, addiction, respiratory depression.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, vomiting, constipation, sedation.
details.sexUse: Can decrease libido and cause erectile dysfunction.
details.mixedUse: Extremely dangerous when mixed with other substances, especially depressants.
details.otherInformation: Fentanyl is a key driver of the opioid epidemic due to its high potency and narrow therapeutic index.

name: Flualprazolam
appearance: White crystalline powder, also available in pellet form.

details.description: A synthetic depressant substance of the benzodiazepine chemical class which produces anxiolytic, disinhibiting, sedative, muscle relaxant, and memory suppressing effects.
details.effects: Relaxation, sedation, reduction in anxiety.
details.dosage: Typically ranges from 0.25 to 1mg; however, recreational use is not recommended.
details.usage: Orally, sometimes insufflated.
details.duration: Effects last approximately 5-8 hours.
details.risks: Addiction, respiratory depression, amnesia.
details.sideEffects: Drowsiness, impaired coordination, vertigo.
details.sexUse: Can reduce libido and impair sexual performance.
details.mixedUse: Very dangerous when mixed with other depressants, can lead to fatal overdose.
details.otherInformation: It is a relatively new substance and its safety profile is not well-established.

name: Flunitrazepam
appearance: White tablet form, sometimes available as a soluble pill.

details.description: A potent benzodiazepine, known for its use as a sedative and amnestic properties. It is infamous for its misuse as a date-rape drug.
details.effects: Sedation, muscle relaxation, and memory loss.
details.dosage: Medical dosage varies, but it's not commonly prescribed due to high abuse potential. Recreational use is strongly discouraged.
details.usage: Orally, sometimes mixed with alcohol or other substances.
details.duration: Effects last 5-8 hours, sometimes longer due to its active metabolites.
details.risks: High risk of overdose, particularly when mixed with alcohol. Can cause amnesia and has been used in sexual assaults.
details.sideEffects: Dizziness, loss of motor control, impaired judgement.
details.sexUse: Infamous for misuse as a date rape drug; usage in a sexual context without consent is a serious crime.
details.mixedUse: Dangerous when mixed with other depressants, risk of fatal overdose.
details.otherInformation: It is controlled under Schedule IV of the Controlled Substances Act in the US.

name: GHB - GBL - BDO
appearance: Liquid form, sometimes found in powder or capsule form.

details.description: A class of drugs that are used for their euphoric and sedative effects. They are known for their high potential for abuse and dependence.
details.effects: Euphoria, relaxation, enhanced sexuality, and transient memory loss.
details.dosage: Dosage varies greatly between individuals, with a therapeutic dose ranging from 1 to 2.5 grams, but recreational use is not recommended due to high risk of overdose.
details.usage: Orally, typically in liquid form.
details.duration: Effects last for 1 to 2 hours, with after-effects lasting up to 4 hours.
details.risks: High risk of overdose, which can result in coma or death. Also has a high potential for addiction.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, vomiting, dizziness, and respiratory depression.
details.sexUse: Has been used as a date-rape drug due to its ability to induce amnesia and impair a person's ability to resist.
details.mixedUse: Highly dangerous when combined with alcohol or other CNS depressants.
details.otherInformation: Controlled in many countries due to its high abuse potential and risk of overdose.

name: Heroin
appearance: White or brown powder, or black sticky substance known as 'black tar heroin'.

details.description: An opioid drug made from morphine, a natural substance taken from the seed pod of various opium poppy plants.
details.effects: Euphoria, drowsiness, and reduced sensation of pain.
details.dosage: Dosages can vary, but recreational use is highly discouraged due to the high risk of overdose and addiction.
details.usage: Injection, snorting, or smoking.
details.duration: Effects can last several hours, depending on the route of administration.
details.risks: Very high risk of overdose and addiction. Long-term use can lead to physical dependence and severe health problems.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, constipation, confusion, and respiratory depression.
details.sexUse: Can reduce libido and impair sexual performance.
details.mixedUse: Combining with other substances, especially alcohol or benzodiazepines, can increase the risk of overdose.
details.otherInformation: It is a Schedule I controlled substance in the US, meaning it has a high potential for abuse and no accepted medical use.

name: Ibogaine
appearance: White powder, typically found in capsules or tablets.

details.description: A psychoactive substance found in plants of the Apocynaceae family, used traditionally in spiritual practices and ceremonies.
details.effects: Alters the state of consciousness, induces visions and insights.
details.dosage: Varies, but it is generally used in a ceremonial context, guided by experienced practitioners.
details.usage: Orally, typically in capsule or tablet form.
details.duration: Effects can last from 24 to 36 hours.
details.risks: Can cause heart complications and potentially be life-threatening. Recreational use is discouraged.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, vomiting, muscle coordination issues, and potential neurotoxicity.
details.sexUse: Not applicable, as it is not used for sexual enhancement.
details.mixedUse: Mixing with other substances increases the risk of adverse reactions.
details.otherInformation: Currently being researched for its potential use in addiction treatment.

name: Ketamine
appearance: White crystalline powder, often found in vials for injection or in tablet form.

details.description: A dissociative anesthetic used in medical settings and also abused recreationally for its hallucinogenic and dissociative effects.
details.effects: Altered perception, hallucinations, and a feeling of detachment from one's body.
details.dosage: Medical dosages are strictly controlled, recreational dosages vary widely but are strongly discouraged.
details.usage: Injection, snorting, or orally.
details.duration: Effects last between 45 minutes to several hours, depending on the route of administration.
details.risks: High potential for abuse and addiction. Can cause severe respiratory depression.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, dizziness, increased heart rate, and potential bladder damage with long-term use.
details.sexUse: Can impair sexual performance and reduce libido.
details.mixedUse: Dangerous when combined with other CNS depressants like alcohol.
details.otherInformation: It is controlled in many countries due to its potential for abuse, but is also used medically in certain situations.

name: Kratom
appearance: Green powdered leaves, also available in capsules and extracts.

details.description: A tropical tree (Mitragyna speciosa) native to Southeast Asia, with leaves that contain compounds that can have psychotropic (mind-altering) effects.
details.effects: Effects vary depending on the dose. It can act as a stimulant at low doses and a sedative at higher doses.
details.dosage: Dosing can be variable and should be carefully controlled, starting at a low dose if used.
details.usage: Orally, through powdered leaves in capsules, teas, or extracts.
details.duration: Effects can last between 2-5 hours, depending on the dose and individual factors.
details.risks: Potential for addiction and withdrawal symptoms. Also associated with side effects like weight loss, loss of appetite, and psychosis.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, vomiting, constipation, and liver damage with prolonged use.
details.sexUse: Not significantly associated with sexual use.
details.mixedUse: Combining with other substances can increase risks and adverse effects.
details.otherInformation: It is not controlled in the United States but is considered a drug of concern.

name: LSD
appearance: Colorless, odorless liquid, often placed on small tabs of paper or gelatin sheets.

details.description: A powerful hallucinogenic drug also known as acid.
details.effects: Altered thoughts, feelings, and awareness of one's surroundings. Can cause hallucinations.
details.dosage: Typically taken in micrograms (µg), with recreational doses often ranging from 50 to 200µg.
details.usage: Orally, typically on small tabs of paper that are placed under the tongue.
details.duration: Effects last between 6-12 hours, with peak effects occurring 2-5 hours after ingestion.
details.risks: Potential for bad trips, flashbacks, and psychosis. It is illegal in most countries.
details.sideEffects: Increased heart rate, sweating, dilated pupils, insomnia, and dry mouth.
details.sexUse: Can alter perception of time and sensory experiences, possibly affecting sexual experiences in unpredictable ways.
details.mixedUse: Can be dangerous when mixed with other substances, especially other psychedelics or stimulants.
details.otherInformation: It has been used in medical research for its potential therapeutic effects in areas such as depression and anxiety.

name: Laughing gas
appearance: Compressed gas in metal cylinders, sometimes used in whipped cream dispensers.

details.description: Nitrous oxide, commonly known as laughing gas, is a colorless, sweet-smelling gas that is sometimes used recreationally for its euphoric and dissociative effects.
details.effects: Euphoria, dizziness, and distortions in sensory perception.
details.dosage: Recreational use typically involves inhaling nitrous oxide from a balloon or canister.
details.usage: Inhaling the gas, often from a balloon or canister.
details.duration: Effects last for a few minutes.
details.risks: Potential for oxygen deprivation if used in an unsafe manner, which can lead to brain damage.
details.sideEffects: Dizziness, nausea, headache, and potential harm from improper administration.
details.sexUse: Not associated with sexual use.
details.mixedUse: Mixing with other substances, especially depressants, can increase risks.
details.otherInformation: Commonly used in medical and dental settings for anesthesia and pain management.

name: Lorazepam (Temesta®)
appearance: Oral tablets or injection.

details.description: A medication of the benzodiazepine class used to treat anxiety disorders, trouble sleeping, and active seizures.
details.effects: Sedation, reduced anxiety, muscle relaxation.
details.dosage: Medical dosage is typically low and carefully controlled; recreational use is strongly discouraged.
details.usage: Orally, in tablet form, or intravenously.
details.duration: Effects last for several hours.
details.risks: Potential for dependence, withdrawal symptoms, and respiratory depression when misused.
details.sideEffects: Drowsiness, dizziness, weakness, and unsteadiness.
details.sexUse: Can impair sexual performance.
details.mixedUse: Dangerous when combined with other depressants like alcohol or opioids.
details.otherInformation: Lorazepam is a prescription medication and should only be used under medical supervision.

name: MDA - MDEA - MBDB
appearance: Usually found in tablet form, sometimes as a powder.

details.description: MDA (3,4-methylenedioxyamphetamine), MDEA (3,4-methylenedioxy-N-ethylamphetamine), and MBDB (N-methyl-1,3-benzodioxolylbutanamine) are empathogenic substances that are chemically related to MDMA (ecstasy).
details.effects: Increased empathy, emotional closeness, and altered sensory perception.
details.dosage: Dosages vary widely and can be risky, as the purity of street drugs is often uncertain.
details.usage: Orally, in tablet form.
details.duration: Effects can last 3-6 hours.
details.risks: Potential for overheating, dehydration, serotonin syndrome, and other health risks.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, confusion, anxiety, and muscle tension.
details.sexUse: Some users report increased intimacy and emotional connection with others.
details.mixedUse: Should not be mixed with other substances, especially other empathogens or antidepressants.
details.otherInformation: These substances are often encountered in pill form on the illicit market, but their purity and safety are not guaranteed.

name: MDMA (Ecstasy)
appearance: Usually found in tablet form, sometimes as a powder.

details.description: A synthetic drug that alters mood and perception. It is chemically similar to stimulants and hallucinogens.
details.effects: Increased energy, euphoria, and altered sensory perception.
details.dosage: Dosages vary widely and can be risky, as the purity of street drugs is often uncertain.
details.usage: Orally, in tablet form.
details.duration: Effects can last 3-6 hours.
details.risks: Potential for overheating, dehydration, serotonin syndrome, and other health risks.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, confusion, anxiety, and muscle tension.
details.sexUse: Some users report increased intimacy and emotional connection with others.
details.mixedUse: Should not be mixed with other substances, especially other empathogens or antidepressants.
details.otherInformation: MDMA is a controlled substance in most countries due to its high potential for abuse and addiction.

name: Mescaline
appearance: White crystalline powder, sometimes found in capsule form.

details.description: A naturally occurring psychedelic substance found in several species of cactus.
details.effects: Altered perception, hallucinations, and euphoria.
details.dosage: Typical doses range from 200 to 500mg, but recreational use is not recommended.
details.usage: Orally, typically in capsule form.
details.duration: Effects last 10-12 hours.
details.risks: Potential for bad trips, flashbacks, and psychosis. It is illegal in most countries.
details.sideEffects: Increased heart rate, sweating, dilated pupils, insomnia, and dry mouth.
details.sexUse: Can alter perception of time and sensory experiences, possibly affecting sexual experiences in unpredictable ways.
details.mixedUse: Can be dangerous when mixed with other substances, especially other psychedelics or stimulants.
details.otherInformation: It has been used in medical research for its potential therapeutic effects in areas such as depression and anxiety.

name: Methamphetamine
appearance: White crystalline powder, sometimes found in capsule form.

details.description: A powerful stimulant that is chemically similar to amphetamine.
details.effects: Increased energy, euphoria, and altered sensory perception.
details.dosage: Dosages vary widely and can be risky, as the purity of street drugs is often uncertain.
details.usage: Orally, in tablet form.
details.duration: Effects can last 3-6 hours.
details.risks: Potential for overheating, dehydration, serotonin syndrome, and other health risks.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, confusion, anxiety, and muscle tension.
details.sexUse: Some users report increased intimacy and emotional connection with others.
details.mixedUse: Should not be mixed with other substances, especially other empathogens or antidepressants.
details.otherInformation: MDMA is a controlled substance in most countries due to its high potential for abuse and addiction.

name: Methcathinone
appearance: White powder or crystalline substance.

details.description: A synthetic stimulant that is chemically similar to methamphetamine. It is a Schedule I controlled substance in the United States.
details.effects: Increased alertness, energy, and euphoria.
details.dosage: Recreational use is illegal and extremely dangerous; safe dosages are not applicable.
details.usage: Orally, snorted, or injected.
details.duration: Effects can last 2-4 hours, depending on the route of administration.
details.risks: High risk of addiction, severe physical and mental health consequences, overdose, and death.
details.sideEffects: Anxiety, paranoia, increased heart rate, and sweating.
details.sexUse: Can increase sexual desire and performance initially but may lead to sexual dysfunction with prolonged use.
details.mixedUse: Dangerous when mixed with other substances, especially other stimulants.
details.otherInformation: Methcathinone is classified as a Schedule I controlled substance in the United States due to its high potential for abuse.

name: Methoxetamine
appearance: White crystalline powder, sometimes found in capsule form.

details.description: A dissociative drug that is chemically similar to ketamine.
details.effects: Altered perception, hallucinations, and a feeling of detachment from one's body.
details.dosage: Typical doses range from 10 to 50mg, but recreational use is not recommended.
details.usage: Orally, typically in capsule form.
details.duration: Effects last 2-3 hours.
details.risks: Potential for bad trips, flashbacks, and psychosis. It is illegal in most countries.
details.sideEffects: Increased heart rate, sweating, dilated pupils, insomnia, and dry mouth.
details.sexUse: Can alter perception of time and sensory experiences, possibly affecting sexual experiences in unpredictable ways.
details.mixedUse: Can be dangerous when mixed with other substances, especially other psychedelics or stimulants.
details.otherInformation: It has been used in medical research for its potential therapeutic effects in areas such as depression and anxiety.

name: Methylone
appearance: Usually found in the form of white or off-white crystalline powder or as tablets.

details.description: A synthetic empathogen and stimulant that is chemically related to MDMA (ecstasy). It is often marketed as a safer alternative to MDMA, but its safety profile is not well understood.
details.effects: Increased empathy, emotional closeness, and alertness.
details.dosage: Dosages vary widely and can be risky, as the purity of street drugs is often uncertain.
details.usage: Orally, in tablet form or as a powder.
details.duration: Effects can last 3-6 hours.
details.risks: Potential for overheating, dehydration, serotonin syndrome, and other health risks.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, confusion, anxiety, and muscle tension.
details.sexUse: Some users report increased intimacy and emotional connection with others.
details.mixedUse: Should not be mixed with other substances, especially other empathogens or antidepressants.
details.otherInformation: Methylone is often marketed as a research chemical or designer drug, and its safety is not well-established.

name: Methylphenidate (Ritalin®)
appearance: Oral tablets or capsules.

details.description: A central nervous system stimulant used in the treatment of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and narcolepsy.
details.effects: Increased focus, attention, and wakefulness.
details.dosage: Medical dosages are carefully controlled and prescribed based on individual needs.
details.usage: Orally, in tablet or capsule form.
details.duration: Effects typically last 3-6 hours, depending on the formulation.
details.risks: Potential for misuse, addiction, and side effects such as increased heart rate and blood pressure.
details.sideEffects: Nervousness, restlessness, and difficulty sleeping.
details.sexUse: Not associated with sexual use.
details.mixedUse: Combining with other substances can increase risks.
details.otherInformation: Methylphenidate is a prescription medication and should only be used as directed by a healthcare professional.

name: Midazolam (Dormicum®)
appearance: Oral tablets, injectable solution, or as a nasal spray.

details.description: A medication of the benzodiazepine class used for its sedative, hypnotic, and anxiolytic (anxiety-reducing) effects.
details.effects: Sedation, relaxation, and reduced anxiety.
details.dosage: Medical dosage is carefully controlled; recreational use is strongly discouraged.
details.usage: Orally, intravenously, or as a nasal spray.
details.duration: Effects typically last for a few hours.
details.risks: Potential for dependence, withdrawal symptoms, and respiratory depression when misused.
details.sideEffects: Drowsiness, dizziness, and impaired coordination.
details.sexUse: Can impair sexual performance.
details.mixedUse: Dangerous when combined with other depressants like alcohol or opioids.
details.otherInformation: Midazolam is a prescription medication and should only be used under medical supervision.

name: Modafinil
appearance: Oral tablets or capsules.

details.description: A medication used to treat sleep disorders such as narcolepsy, obstructive sleep apnea, and shift work sleep disorder.
details.effects: Increased wakefulness, alertness, and improved cognitive function.
details.dosage: Medical dosages are carefully controlled and prescribed based on the specific sleep disorder being treated.
details.usage: Orally, in tablet or capsule form.
details.duration: Effects typically last for 6-12 hours.
details.risks: Potential for misuse, dependence, and side effects such as nervousness and headache.
details.sideEffects: Headache, nausea, and nervousness.
details.sexUse: Not associated with sexual use.
details.mixedUse: Combining with other substances can increase risks.
details.otherInformation: Modafinil is a prescription medication and should only be used as directed by a healthcare professional.

name: Morphine / morphine
appearance: Oral tablets, capsules, liquid solutions, or injectable formulations.

details.description: A powerful opioid analgesic used for pain relief, but also a drug with a high potential for abuse and addiction.
details.effects: Pain relief, euphoria, and a sense of relaxation.
details.dosage: Medical dosages are carefully controlled and based on the severity of pain and individual factors.
details.usage: Orally, intravenously, or by injection.
details.duration: Effects typically last 3-6 hours, depending on the formulation and dosage.
details.risks: High risk of addiction, overdose, and respiratory depression.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, constipation, drowsiness, and confusion.
details.sexUse: Not associated with sexual use.
details.mixedUse: Dangerous when mixed with other substances, especially other depressants like alcohol or benzodiazepines.
details.otherInformation: Morphine is a controlled substance and is available only by prescription.

name: New Psychoactive Substances (NPS)
appearance: Varies widely depending on the specific substance, often sold as powders, pills, or liquids.

details.description: A broad category of synthetic drugs designed to mimic the effects of controlled substances while avoiding legal restrictions.
details.effects: Effects vary widely depending on the specific NPS, ranging from stimulant-like effects to hallucinations.
details.dosage: Highly variable and depends on the specific substance. The purity and composition can be uncertain with NPS.
details.usage: Orally, through various forms such as powders, pills, or liquids.
details.duration: Duration varies widely depending on the specific substance.
details.risks: High risk of unknown composition, potential for severe health effects, and legal consequences.
details.sideEffects: Can range from mild to severe depending on the substance, including anxiety, paranoia, and physical health issues.
details.sexUse: Not associated with sexual use.
details.mixedUse: Extremely unpredictable when mixed with other substances.
details.otherInformation: NPS are a constantly evolving and challenging category of substances that may evade legal regulations.

name: Neuroleptics
appearance: Available in various forms including oral tablets, liquid solutions, and injectable formulations.

details.description: A class of drugs primarily used to manage psychiatric disorders such as schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.
details.effects: Reduced symptoms of psychosis and mood stabilization.
details.dosage: Medical dosages are carefully controlled and tailored to individual patient needs.
details.usage: Orally, intravenously, or by injection, as prescribed by a healthcare professional.
details.duration: Effects typically last for several hours.
details.risks: Potential for side effects including weight gain, metabolic changes, and movement disorders.
details.sideEffects: Sedation, weight gain, tremors, and extrapyramidal symptoms.
details.sexUse: Not associated with sexual use.
details.mixedUse: Should not be mixed with other substances without medical supervision.
details.otherInformation: Neuroleptics are prescription medications and should only be used as directed by a healthcare professional.

name: Oxazepam (Seresta®)
appearance: Oral tablets or capsules.

details.description: A medication of the benzodiazepine class used to treat anxiety disorders and alcohol withdrawal.
details.effects: Sedation, reduced anxiety, muscle relaxation.
details.dosage: Medical dosages are carefully controlled and prescribed based on individual needs.
details.usage: Orally, in tablet or capsule form.
details.duration: Effects typically last for several hours.
details.risks: Potential for dependence, withdrawal symptoms, and respiratory depression when misused.
details.sideEffects: Drowsiness, dizziness, and impaired coordination.
details.sexUse: Can impair sexual performance.
details.mixedUse: Dangerous when combined with other depressants like alcohol or opioids.
details.otherInformation: Oxazepam is a prescription medication and should only be used as directed by a healthcare professional.

name: Oxycodone
appearance: Oral tablets, capsules, or liquid solutions.

details.description: A powerful opioid analgesic used to manage severe pain, but it is also highly addictive and subject to abuse.
details.effects: Pain relief, euphoria, and a sense of relaxation.
details.dosage: Medical dosages are carefully controlled and prescribed based on the severity of pain and individual factors.
details.usage: Orally, sometimes in combination with other non-opioid pain relievers.
details.duration: Effects typically last 3-6 hours, depending on the formulation and dosage.
details.risks: High risk of addiction, overdose, and respiratory depression.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, constipation, drowsiness, and confusion.
details.sexUse: Not associated with sexual use.
details.mixedUse: Dangerous when mixed with other substances, especially other depressants like alcohol or benzodiazepines.
details.otherInformation: Oxycodone is a controlled substance and is available only by prescription.

name: Poppers
appearance: Often sold in small bottles as a volatile liquid, which releases a vapor when opened.

details.description: A group of chemicals known as alkyl nitrites, which are inhaled for their short-lasting, intense, and pleasurable effects.
details.effects: Rapid head rush, muscle relaxation, and enhanced sexual pleasure.
details.dosage: Poppers are typically inhaled directly from the bottle, but their use can be unpredictable.
details.usage: Inhaling the vapor directly from the bottle.
details.duration: Effects last for a few minutes or less.
details.risks: Potential for dangerous interactions with other drugs, as well as risks associated with inhaling volatile chemicals.
details.sideEffects: Headache, dizziness, and potential harm from improper inhalation.
details.sexUse: Commonly used to enhance sexual experiences due to its muscle relaxant effects.
details.mixedUse: Should not be mixed with other substances, especially erectile dysfunction medications.
details.otherInformation: Poppers are often sold as a 'room odorizer' or 'video head cleaner' to circumvent legal restrictions.

name: Psilocybin / Psilocin
appearance: Dried or fresh mushrooms containing psilocybin and psilocin, or as a brown powder in capsules.

details.description: Psychedelic compounds found in certain species of mushrooms, known for their hallucinogenic properties.
details.effects: Altered perception, visual hallucinations, and introspective experiences.
details.dosage: Dosages vary depending on the specific mushroom species and preparation method.
details.usage: Orally, by consuming dried or fresh mushrooms, or as a brown powder in capsules.
details.duration: Effects can last 4-6 hours.
details.risks: Potential for adverse reactions, psychological distress, and flashbacks.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, vomiting, confusion, and altered thought processes.
details.sexUse: Not typically associated with sexual use.
details.mixedUse: Should not be mixed with other substances, especially other psychedelics.
details.otherInformation: Psilocybin-containing mushrooms are illegal in many countries and are subject to legal restrictions.

name: Salvia divinorum
appearance: Dried leaves, extracts, or tinctures made from the Salvia divinorum plant.

details.description: A psychoactive plant native to Mexico known for its powerful but short-lived hallucinogenic effects.
details.effects: Intense visual and sensory distortions, time distortion, and dissociation from reality.
details.dosage: Dosages vary depending on the form of the substance, but it is considered extremely potent.
details.usage: Orally, by chewing the leaves, smoking, or vaporizing extracts.
details.duration: Effects are brief, typically lasting only a few minutes to around 30 minutes.
details.risks: Potential for unpredictable, intense experiences, and impaired judgment.
details.sideEffects: Disorientation, confusion, and the possibility of physical harm during intense experiences.
details.sexUse: Not typically associated with sexual use.
details.mixedUse: Should not be mixed with other substances, especially other hallucinogens.
details.otherInformation: Salvia divinorum is regulated or illegal in some countries due to its potent effects.

name: Synthetic cannabinoids
appearance: Sprayed onto plant material to resemble natural cannabis, sold as dried plant material or liquid for use in e-cigarettes.

details.description: A group of synthetic compounds designed to mimic the effects of THC, the active compound in natural cannabis.
details.effects: Varies widely depending on the specific synthetic cannabinoid, often unpredictable and intense.
details.dosage: Highly variable, and the purity and composition can be uncertain with synthetic cannabinoids.
details.usage: Smoked, vaporized, or inhaled, often sold as an herbal smoking blend or as a liquid for use in e-cigarettes.
details.duration: Effects can be very brief, often lasting only a short time.
details.risks: High risk of adverse reactions, including anxiety, paranoia, hallucinations, and serious health effects.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, anxiety, rapid heartbeat, and confusion.
details.sexUse: Not typically associated with sexual use.
details.mixedUse: Should not be mixed with other substances.
details.otherInformation: Synthetic cannabinoids are often marketed as a legal or safe alternative to natural cannabis but can be dangerous.

name: Tobacco (nicotine)
appearance: Found in various forms including cigarettes, cigars, pipe tobacco, and smokeless products like chewing tobacco and snuff.

details.description: A plant-based substance containing the alkaloid nicotine, known for its addictive properties and widespread use.
details.effects: Stimulation, relaxation, and reduced stress or anxiety, but it is highly addictive.
details.dosage: Nicotine levels vary depending on the tobacco product, often measured in milligrams per cigarette or cigar.
details.usage: Orally or by inhalation through smoking or smokeless products.
details.duration: Nicotine's effects can be felt quickly and last for a short duration, leading to frequent use.
details.risks: Highly addictive, with potential for serious health consequences including cancer, heart disease, and respiratory issues.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, dizziness, increased heart rate, and cravings during withdrawal.
details.sexUse: Not typically associated with sexual use.
details.mixedUse: Combining with other substances can increase risks, especially when combined with alcohol.
details.otherInformation: Tobacco use is a leading cause of preventable deaths worldwide and is subject to various legal restrictions.

name: Tilidine
appearance: Oral tablets or capsules.

details.description: A synthetic opioid analgesic used for pain relief, often in combination with other medications.
details.effects: Pain relief, relaxation, and euphoria.
details.dosage: Medical dosages are carefully controlled and prescribed based on the severity of pain and individual factors.
details.usage: Orally, in tablet or capsule form.
details.duration: Effects typically last 3-6 hours, depending on the formulation and dosage.
details.risks: High risk of addiction, overdose, and respiratory depression.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, constipation, drowsiness, and confusion.
details.sexUse: Not associated with sexual use.
details.mixedUse: Dangerous when mixed with other substances, especially other depressants like alcohol or benzodiazepines.
details.otherInformation: Tilidine is a controlled substance and is available only by prescription.

name: Tramadol
appearance: Oral tablets, capsules, or liquid formulations.

details.description: A synthetic opioid analgesic used for pain relief, particularly for moderate to moderately severe pain.
details.effects: Pain relief, relaxation, and potential for mild euphoria.
details.dosage: Medical dosages are carefully controlled and prescribed based on the specific pain condition and individual factors.
details.usage: Orally, in tablet, capsule, or liquid form.
details.duration: Effects typically last 4-6 hours.
details.risks: Potential for misuse, addiction, and side effects such as nausea and dizziness.
details.sideEffects: Nausea, vomiting, dizziness, and constipation.
details.sexUse: Not associated with sexual use.
details.mixedUse: Dangerous when mixed with other substances, especially other depressants like alcohol or benzodiazepines.
details.otherInformation: Tramadol is a controlled substance in some countries and is available only by prescription.

name: Viagra®
appearance: Oral tablets.

details.description: A medication used to treat erectile dysfunction by increasing blood flow to the penis.
details.effects: Improved ability to achieve and maintain an erection.
details.dosage: Medical dosages are carefully controlled and prescribed by a healthcare professional.
details.usage: Orally, in tablet form.
details.duration: Effects typically last for a few hours.
details.risks: Potential for side effects such as headache, flushing, and interactions with other medications.
details.sideEffects: Headache, flushing, indigestion, and visual disturbances.
details.sexUse: Specifically used to enhance sexual performance.
details.mixedUse: Should not be mixed with other substances without medical guidance.
details.otherInformation: Viagra® is a prescription medication and should only be used as directed by a healthcare professional.
